babble.net.http

Class HttpRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • babble.net.NetworkBuffer
      • babble.net.Request
        • babble.net.http.HttpRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class HttpRequest
extends Request
    A HTTP request. A request carries requisite input to an operation. This facility parses an array of raw bytes (possibly read from a channel at the network layer). The parsing process enforces HTTP request grammar.
    Author:
    pinaki poddar
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(ByteChannel channel,
                   byte[] data)
            throws ProtocolException
        Create a request given the a network channel and raw byte data (possibly read from the same channel). A request is bound to this channel and the response from this request will be sent via the same channel unless specified another channel is explicitly set.
        Parameters:
        channel - must not be null.
        data - raw byte data. Must follow HTTP request syntax.
        Throws:
        ProtocolException

              throws ProtocolException
        Parses given string as per HTTP Request format.
        Parameters:
        content - a string as HTTP request
        Throws:
        ProtocolException - if parsing fails

      • addHeader

        public void addHeader(String name,
                      String value)
        Adds a header.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the header field e.g. Content-Length. Must not be null.
        value - value of the header e.g. 2034 as a string. Can be null.

      • getHeader

        public babble.net.http.HttpHeader getHeader(String name)

      • setMethod

        protected HttpRequest setMethod(String method)
                         throws ProtocolException
        Sets HTTP method.
        Parameters:
        method - must be a HTTP method name e.g. GET, PUT etc. This argument can be in any case, but getMethod() will return the name in upper case.
        Returns:
        the same request
        Throws:
        ProtocolException

      • getMethod

        public String getMethod()
        Gets HTTP method name.
        Returns:
        HTTP method name e.g. GET PUT etc. Never null.

      • getPath

        public String getPath()
        Gets path of this request without any leading forward slash '/'
        Returns:
        path of this request. Can be empty or null. null implies that path has not been defined.

      • getVersion

        public String getVersion()
        Gets HTTP version.
        Returns:
        HTTP version string e.g. HTTP/1.1

      • send

        public void send(ByteChannel channel)
          throws IOException
        Writes this request to i/o channel. HTTP request follows a particular format: method SP path SP version CRLF
        Specified by:
        send in class Request
        Throws:
        IOException - if can not be sent over the channel

      • setPath

        protected void setPath(String path)
                throws ProtocolException
        Sets the path. The path is saved as it is received. a path string can begin with a forward slash. However, getPath() will return a path without a forward slash.
        Parameters:
        path -
        Throws:
        ProtocolException
